title: Ticket #5177: test job_test_urlfetch
description:
Test condor_url fetch. No condor is needed to be run. We have a number of steps we want to take.

  1. Establich the simple python based simple webserver which routinely listens at port 8000. See about a test specific port and take down the web server when the test is done with it. an optional arg can be used to listen on a different port.
  2. be in a test specific directory when the server is started and remove this directory when the test is done with it.
  3. Create a new perl module ConfigTools to gather config tools scattered amongst other tests and then adapt those tests to use same perl module.
  4. take the results from the generate config function to drop a file into the simple web server top folder, create the associated config based on running condor_urlfetch within an initial config file for the test.

things to test

  1. The results for dumping unique* should be what we wrote to the web server location.
  2. local config file should be set to the entire urlfetch line from the config file processed.
  3. There should be no leaking of temp files
  4. if it is not -master, but say -schedd, the specified file cache should not be changed.
  5. If the web server is down, the config cache file should be used.
